snippet: A Canadian study found that pesticides were four times more likely to be linked with bird losses than any other cause.
abstract: Editorial highlights study finding that collapsing populations of grassland birds are more strongly correlated with insecticide use than with habitat alteration; expresses hope that study will cause Environmental Protection Agency to consider next generation of insecticides in more critical light.
lead_paragraph: A Canadian study found that pesticides were four times more likely to be linked with bird losses than any other cause.
